## Course Structure

```
{{COURSE_SLUG}}/
├── README.md                    # This file
├── SYLLABUS.md                  # Complete course syllabus
├── modules/                     # Course content by module (Lessons, Exercises, Quizzes)
│   ├── 01-{{MODULE_01_SLUG}}/
│   ├── 02-{{MODULE_02_SLUG}}/
│   ├── 03-{{MODULE_03_SLUG}}/
│   ├── 04-{{MODULE_04_SLUG}}/
│   ├── 05-{{MODULE_05_SLUG}}/
│   ├── 06-{{MODULE_06_SLUG}}/
│   ├── 07-{{MODULE_07_SLUG}}/
│   ├── 08-{{MODULE_08_SLUG}}/
│   ├── 09-{{MODULE_09_SLUG}}/
│   ├── 10-{{MODULE_10_SLUG}}/
│   ├── 11-{{MODULE_11_SLUG}}/
│   └── 12-{{MODULE_12_SLUG}}/
├── templates/                   # Reusable templates
├── examples/                    # Code examples
├── prompts/                     # AI prompt library
└── resources/                   # Additional resources
```

---

## Quick Start

### 1. Set Up Your Environment

```bash
{{SETUP_COMMANDS}}
```

### 2. Start with Module 1

Open `modules/01-{{MODULE_01_SLUG}}/README.md` and follow the instructions.

### 3. Complete Exercises

Each module has a hands-on `EXERCISE.md` file (e.g., `modules/01-{{MODULE_01_SLUG}}/EXERCISE.md`).

### 4. Take Assessments

Test your knowledge with the `QUIZ.md` file in each module folder.

### 5. Build Final Project

Apply everything in Module 10's real-world project.
